metadata.title: Cloud Infrastructure Component Definitions for FedRAMP

props.name: keywords
props.value: cloud, infrastructure, AWS, Kubernetes, FedRAMP, security controls

roles.title: Cloud Solutions Architect
roles.description: Responsible for designing and implementing cloud infrastructure components

roles.title: Security Engineer
roles.description: Responsible for security implementation and compliance validation

components.title: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2)
components.description: Amazon EC2 provides scalable computing capacity in the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Cloud, eliminating the need to invest in hardware up front.
components.purpose: Provides virtualized compute infrastructure for hosting applications and services with on-demand scalability

control-implementations.description: Security control implementations for AWS EC2 instances

implemented-requirements.description: EC2 Security Groups provide network-level access control by acting as virtual firewalls that control inbound and outbound traffic to EC2 instances.

statements.description: AWS EC2 Security Groups control communications at the boundary between the system and external networks by defining allowed protocols, ports, and source/destination IP ranges.

implemented-requirements.description: AWS CloudTrail automatically logs all EC2 API calls and administrative actions for audit purposes.

statements.description: CloudTrail provides comprehensive audit logging of EC2 instance lifecycle events, configuration changes, and administrative actions with tamper-evident log storage in S3.

implemented-requirements.description: EC2 instances support multiple authentication mechanisms including SSH key pairs, AWS Systems Manager Session Manager, and integration with AWS IAM.

statements.description: EC2 instances uniquely identify and authenticate users through SSH key-based authentication, AWS IAM integration, and optional multi-factor authentication via Session Manager.

components.title: Kubernetes Container Orchestration Platform
components.description: Kubernetes is an open-source container orchestration platform that automates deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.
components.purpose: Provides container orchestration, automated deployment, scaling, and management of microservices applications

control-implementations.description: Security control implementations for Kubernetes platform

implemented-requirements.description: Kubernetes Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) enforces access control decisions by regulating access to cluster resources based on the roles of individual users.

statements.description: Kubernetes RBAC controls access to cluster resources through Role and ClusterRole definitions that specify permitted actions on specific resources, bound to users and service accounts through RoleBindings.

implemented-requirements.description: Kubernetes Network Policies control information flow between pods, namespaces, and external endpoints by defining ingress and egress rules.

statements.description: Network Policies implement micro-segmentation by controlling traffic flow between pods based on labels, namespaces, and IP blocks, preventing unauthorized communication within the cluster.

implemented-requirements.description: Kubernetes audit logging provides comprehensive timestamped records of all API server requests and cluster activities.

statements.description: Kubernetes API server audit logs include precise timestamps for all requests, providing detailed records of who performed what actions on which resources at specific times.

components.title: NGINX Web Server and Reverse Proxy
components.description: NGINX is a high-performance HTTP server, reverse proxy, and load balancer known for its stability, rich feature set, simple configuration, and low resource consumption.
components.purpose: Serves web content, provides reverse proxy functionality, SSL termination, and load balancing for web applications

control-implementations.description: Security control implementations for NGINX web server

implemented-requirements.description: NGINX implements TLS encryption for all client communications and upstream connections to protect data in transit.

statements.description: NGINX is configured with TLS 1.2 and 1.3 protocols, modern cipher suites, and HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) to ensure confidentiality and integrity of transmitted information.

implemented-requirements.description: NGINX provides comprehensive access logging with customizable log formats including timestamps, client information, and request details.

statements.description: NGINX access logs include ISO 8601 formatted timestamps, client IP addresses, HTTP methods, response codes, and user agent information for comprehensive audit trails.

implemented-requirements.description: NGINX implements session protection through secure session management and cookie security controls.

statements.description: NGINX is configured to set secure session cookies with HttpOnly and Secure flags, implement session timeout controls, and protect against session fixation and hijacking attacks.
